Name: AMBER[1]
Comments: High Performance MD, Comprehensive analysis tools

Name: Abalone
Comments: Biomolecular simulations, protein folding.

Name: ADF
Comments: Modeling suite: ReaxFF, UFF, QM-MM with Amber and Tripos force fields, DFT and semi-empirical methods, conformational analysis with RDKit; partly GPU-accelerated

Name: Ascalaph Designer
Comments: Molecular building (DNA, proteins, hydrocarbons, nanotubes), molecular dynamics, GPU acceleration
License: Mixed: free open source (GNU GPL) & commercial

Name: Avogadro
Comments: Molecule building, editing (peptides, small molecules, crystals), conformational analysis, 2D/3D conversion; extensible interfaces to other tools

Name: BOSS
Comments: OPLS

Name: CHARMM
Comments: Commercial version with multiple graphical front ends is sold by BIOVIA (as CHARMm), formerly Accelrys.

Name: CHEMKIN
Comments: Chemical reaction kinetics.

Name: CP2K
Comments: CP2K can perform atomistic and molecular simulations of solid state, liquid and biological systems.
License: Free open source GNU GPLv2 or later

Name: Desmond
Comments: High performance MD; has comprehensive GUI to build, visualize, and review results and calculation setup up and launch

Name: Discovery Studio
Comments: Comprehensive life science modeling and simulation suite of applications focused on optimizing drug discovery process: small molecule simulations, QM-MM, pharmacophore modeling, QSAR, protein-ligand docking, protein homology modeling, sequence analysis, protein-protein docking, antibody modeling, etc.

Name: fold.it
Comments: University of Washington and The Baker Labs; structure prediction, protein folding

Name: FoldX
Comments: Energy calculations, protein design

Name: GROMACS
Comments: High performance MD

Name: GROMOS
Comments: Intended for biomolecules

Name: LAMMPS
Comments: Has potentials for soft and solid-state materials and coarse-grain systems

Name: MacroModel
Comments: OPLS-AA, MMFF, GBSA solvent model, conformational sampling, minimizing, MD. Includes the Maestro GUI which provides visualizing, molecule building, calculation setup, job launch and monitoring, project-level organizing of results, access to a suite of other modelling programs.

Name: MAPS[4]
Comments: Building, visualizing, and analysis tools in one user interface, with access to multiple simulation engines

Name: Materials Studio
Comments: Environment that brings materials simulation technology to desktop computing, solving key problems in R&D processes

Name: MBN Explorer[5] + MBN Studio
Comments: Standard and reactive CHARMM force fields; molecular modeler (carbon nanomaterials, biomolecules, nanocrystals); explicit library of examples

Name: MDynaMix
Comments: Parallel MD

Name: ms2
Comments: direct on the fly computation of large number of thermophysical properties. Main application of ms2 is on fluids.

Name: MOE
Comments: Molecular Operating Environment (MOE)

Name: Orac
Comments: Molecular dynamics simulation program to explore free energy surfaces in biomolecular systems at the atomic level

Name: NAMD + VMD
Comments: Fast, parallel MD, CUDA
License: Proprietary, free academic use, source code

Name: NWChem
Comments: High-performance computational chemistry software, includes quantum mechanics, molecular dynamics and combined QM-MM methods
License: Free open source, Educational Community License version 2.0

Name: Protein Local Optimization Program
Comments: Helix, loop, and side chain optimizing, fast energy minimizing

Name: Q
Comments: (I) Free energy perturbation (FEP) simulations, (II) empirical valence bond (EVB), calculations of reaction free energies, (III) linear interaction energy (LIE) calculations of receptor-ligand binding affinities
License: Free open source GNU GPLv2 or later

Name: SAMSON
Comments: Computational nanoscience (life sciences, materials, etc.). Modular architecture, modules termed SAMSON Elements

Name: Scigress
Comments: MM, DFT, semiempirical methods, parallel MD, conformational analysis, Linear scaling SCF, docking protein-ligand, Batch processing, virtual screening, automated builders (molecular dynamics, proteins, crystals)

Name: Spartan
Comments: Small molecule (< 2,000 a.m.u.) MM and QM tools to determine conformation, structure, property, spectra, reactivity, and selectivity.

Name: TeraChem
Comments: High performance GPU-accelerated ab initio molecular dynamics and TD/DFT software package for very large molecular or even nanoscale systems. Runs on NVIDIA GPUs and 64-bit Linux, has heavily optimized CUDA code.

Name: TINKER
Comments: Software tools for molecular design-Tinker-OpenMM[6] Software tools for molecular design-Tinker-HP[7]

Name: Tremolo-X
Comments: Fast, parallel MD

Name: UCSF Chimera
Comments: Visually appealing viewer, amino acid rotamers and other building, includes Antechamber and MMTK, Ambertools plugins in development.

Name: YASARA
Comments: Molecular graphics, modeling, simulation
